title.narrative: 07-02 CHILD POVERTY PUBLIC FINANCING

description.narrative: 7.2. By 2021, the Government has enhanced capacity, improved systems, and evidence for child sensitive public finance and development planning at national and subnational levels., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Building Capacity For Evaluation, Evaluation, Public Finance And Local Governance, Reducing Child Poverty, Research, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 7. By 2021, Vulnerable children and families benefit from and participate in a strengthened government response to poverty and vulnerability.

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF LOCAL GOVERNMENT AND HOUSING
ZAMBIA INSITUTE FOR POLICY ANALYSIS AND RESEARCH

sector.narrative: Building evaluation capacity in UNICEF and the UN system
Building research capacity in UNICEF and the UN system
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
PF4C: Budget transparency, accountability and participation
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

description.narrative: Development Partner affairs Technical staff services
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)
